transcript.content: And so that's when I started having, I would say problems, besides maybe just being kicked out of school once, and that was really for missing too many days. I don't know why I was missing all of them days. But I was missing a lot of days of school.

transcript.content: Was there fighting?

transcript.content: James Derome. Okay, well, my elementary schools are Florence Johnson Chester School. Grade school I ended up at James Derome. For high school, I went to L. E. Rabouin.

transcript.content: A few was getting high, but everybody else was like really selling them. And even it was showing love, like, bad love because he was giving me money. transcript.content: Yeah, that type of deal, they never stayed. I mean, like I said, as long as I ever seen was six months, you wouldn't think 27 years later I'd still be here, that type of thing.

transcript.speaker: Marcus

transcript.content: But I was hell bent on never been on that ground with the way, it's just something about his murder, even though it was right there with the other guys killed in that hallway. And I'm like, "God that is serious."

transcript.speaker: Sherman
transcript.content: Because I was on that pack with them. When she took him to the parks into the beach, I was with him. But again I chose that other crew to hang with and all of them are dead right now. Every last one of them, been dead a long, long time ago

transcript.content: Oh definitely. I needed the first six years to really calm down see after that I was like, "Okay, I definitely need to be getting things." Now, I always was educating myself, but it was like something just clicked like, "Okay, you know, I want the world to be a better place."

transcript.speaker: Sherman
transcript.content: And I've been that way ever since. transcript.content: She did a whole bunch of that stuff. You know she's down here now. transcript.content: So I think he has served two, three years or something one time, and I don't think he actually learned his lesson. transcript.content: Actually my daughter the one I'm telling you, she's crazy. But she just got this lawsuit like a half a million dollars. transcript.content: So she just came back. She had spent like three weeks there, but she got to always be on a run, and I hate that but, it's her life. But she's doing everything right. transcript.content: So I'm like, okay, that don't sound too good. So I'm kind of nervous and at the same like, man I will format to go with all this. transcript.content: So you won't be around, let's say 60 Guys, at that time in a dorm. transcript.speaker: Sherman
transcript.content: But I think after my talk with him, I kind of settled down. Oh, see, okay, I don't have to hurt this guy. He's not trying anything. Because for one, I'm not going to do any drugs. I'm not going to mess with your phone call, I'm not going to mess with gambling. I'm not a gamble.

transcript.speaker: Sherman
transcript.content: So I'm not, there's no reason for you just not to just come build a case on me. What are you looking at me for, or something? And I'm going to talk my way out of that. transcript.speaker: Sherman
transcript.content: I mean first day, you better be rolled in with it, because, like I say, everybody on the tier was like, 26 guys, you got to think for every last one of them on there, at any time, anything can go wrong, behind something so trivial. transcript.speaker: Sherman
transcript.content: But the six years that it took I mean, what I mean by that from, I was ready to go home and continue selling drugs up until that because I'm like, "Whoa, they're doing that now." transcript.speaker: Sherman
transcript.content: But you're not going to die of starvation in Angola at all. Because you're going to eat three times a day no matter what, never missed yet, in 27 years. transcript.speaker: Sherman
transcript.content: Six years I have matured real well then, and I'm looking at all these guys at that point they've been here 37 years. And now these guys have been in 60 years. Sort of like okay. I'm hoping that is not mine, definitely.

transcript.speaker: Sherman
transcript.content: It's just you got to really learn, and then six years, it definitely shaped me as far as looking at how other people will get messed over for little things. transcript.content: Because a lot of guys, I'd be mindful that a lot of that was here, I had dealt with them in the past as far as whether they worked for me, or I knew them, or the dad or whoever. And so everything was here that I wanted to meet.
